com.stormpath.sdk.application
Interface AccountStoreMapping

All Superinterfaces:
Deletable, Resource, Saveable
public interface AccountStoreMapping
extends Resource, Saveable, Deletable

An AccountStoreMapping represents the assignment of an AccountStore (either a Group or Directory) to an Application.

When an AccountStoreMapping is created, the accounts in the account store are granted access to (become users of) the linked Application. The order in which AccountStores are assigned to an application determines how login attempts work in Stormpath.

Default Account Store

Additionally, an AccountStoreMapping may be designated as the Application's defaultAccountStore. This causes any accounts created directly by the application to be dispatched to and saved in the associated AccountStore, since an Application cannot store accounts directly.

Default Group Store

Similarly, an AccountStoreMapping may be designated as the Application's defaultGroupStore. This causes any groups created directly by the application to be dispatched to and saved in the associated AccountStore, since an Application cannot store groups directly. Note: A Group cannot store other Groups. Therefore, the default group store must be a Directory.

Since:
0.9
See Also:
Application.createAccountStoreMapping(AccountStoreMapping)

getListIndex

int getListIndex()
Returns the zero-based order in which the associated accountStore will be consulted by the linked getApplication() during an account authentication attempt.

The lower the index, the higher precedence - the earlier it will be accessed - during an authentication attempt. The higher the index, the lower the precedence - the later it will be accessed - during an authentication attempt.

See the setListIndex JavaDoc for more information.

Returns:
the zero-based order in which the associated accountStore will be consulted by the linked getApplication() during an account authentication attempt.
See Also:
setListIndex(int)

setListIndex

void setListIndex(int listIndex)
Updates the zero-based order in which the associated accountStore will be consulted by the linked getApplication() during an account authentication attempt.

USAGE NOTE: If you use this setter then you will invalidate the cache for all of the associated Application's other AccountStoreMappings.

Authentication Process and AccountStoreMapping Order

During an authentication attempt, an Application consults its mapped account stores in iteration order, trying to find the first matching account to use for authentication. The lower the AccountStoreMapping index (closer to zero), the earlier that store is consulted during authentication. If no matching account is found in an account store, the application will move on to the next AccountStore (next highest index) in the list. This continues either a matching account is found, or until all account stores are exhausted. When a matching account is found, the process is short-circuited and the discovered account will be used immediately for authentication.

When calling this method, you control where the new AccountStoreMapping will reside in the Application's overall list by setting its (zero-based) listIndex property before calling this method.

listIndex values

  • negative: attempting to set a negative listIndex will cause an Error
  • zero: the account store mapping will be the first item in the list (and therefore consulted first during the authentication process).
  • positive: the account store mapping will be inserted at that index. Because list indices are zero-based, the account store will be in the list at position listIndex - 1.
Any listIndex value equal to or greater than the current list size will automatically append the AccountStoreMapping at the end of the list.

Example

Setting a new AccountStoreMapping's listIndex to 500 and then adding the mapping to an application with an existing 3-item list will automatically save the AccountStoreMapping at the end of the list and set its listIndex value to 3 (items at index 0, 1, 2 were the original items, the new fourth item will be at index 3).

Parameters:
listIndex - the zero based index

isDefaultAccountStore

boolean isDefaultAccountStore()
Returns true if the associated accountStore is designated as the application's default account store, false otherwise.

A true value indicates that any accounts created directly by the application will be dispatched to and saved in the associated AccountStore, since an Application cannot store accounts directly.

Returns:
true if the associated accountStore is designated as the application's default account store, false otherwise.

setDefaultAccountStore

void setDefaultAccountStore(boolean defaultAccountStore)
Sets whether or not the associated accountStore is designated as the application's default account store.

A true value indicates that any accounts created directly by the application will be dispatched to and saved in the associated AccountStore, since an Application cannot store accounts directly.

USAGE NOTE: If you use this setter then you will invalidate the cache for all of the associated Application's other AccountStoreMappings.

Parameters:
defaultAccountStore - whether or not the associated accountStore is designated as the application's default account store.

isDefaultGroupStore

boolean isDefaultGroupStore()
Returns true if the associated accountStore is designated as the application's default group store, false otherwise.

A true value indicates that any groups created directly by the application will be dispatched to and saved in the associated AccountStore, since an Application cannot store accounts directly.

Returns:
true if the associated accountStore is designated as the application's default group store, false otherwise.

setDefaultGroupStore

void setDefaultGroupStore(boolean defaultGroupStore)
Sets whether or not the associated accountStore is designated as the application's default group store.

A true value indicates that any groups created directly by the application will be dispatched to and saved in the associated AccountStore, since an Application cannot store accounts directly.

USAGE NOTE: If you use this setter then you will invalidate the cache for all of the associated Application's other AccountStoreMappings.

Directory Only

Stormpath currently only supports Directories (not Groups) as a group store. Attempting to set this value to true if the associated accountStore is a Group and then calling save will result in a ResourceException.

Parameters:
defaultGroupStore - true if the associated accountStore is designated as the application's default group store, false otherwise.
